content: Created a reusable `workflow_call` workflow at `.github/workflows/e2e_failure.yml` that standardizes E2E failure diagnostics collection by checking out the repo and invoking the local `e2e-on-failure` composite action with configurable artifact/retention inputs.

output.code:
from pathlib import Path
import json

target_path = Path('/mnt/data').joinpath('.github/workflows/e2e_failure.yml')
target_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)

chunks = [r"""name: e2e-failure-diagnostics

on:
  workflow_call:
    inputs:
      artifact_name:
        description: Name of the uploaded diagnostics artifact.
        required: false
        type: string
        default: e2e-diagnostics
      diagnostics_dir:
        description: Directory to write collected diagnostics into (relative to repository root).
        required: false
        type: string
        default: e2e-diagnostics
      retention_days:
        description: Artifact retention period in days.
        required: false
        type: number
        default: 7
      runner:
        description: Runner label to execute diagnostics collection on.
        required: false
        type: string
        default: ubuntu-latest
      checkout_ref:
        description: Optional ref to checkout (defaults to the workflow SHA).
        required: false
        type: string
    secrets:
      GITHUB_TOKEN:
        required: false

jobs:
  collect:
    name: Collect E2E failure diagnostics
    runs-on: ${{ inputs.runner }}
    permissions:
      contents: read
      actions: read
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          ref: ${{ inputs.checkout_ref || github.sha }}

      - name: Collect + upload diagnostics (only when prior job failed)
        uses: ./.github/actions/e2e-on-failure
        with:
          diagnostics_dir: ${{ inputs.diagnostics_dir }}
          artifact_name: ${{ inputs.artifact_name }}
          retention_days: ${{ inputs.retention_days }}"""]

final_text = '\n'.join(block.strip('\n') for block in chunks).strip() + '\n'
target_path.write_text(final_text, encoding='utf-8')

print('FILE_WRITTEN:.github/workflows/e2e_failure.yml')
print('DIR_STATE:' + json.dumps(sorted(str(p.relative_to(Path("/mnt/data"))) for p in target_path.parent.glob('*') if p.is_file())))

content.text: Created a reusable `workflow_call` workflow at `.github/workflows/e2e_failure.yml` that standardizes E2E failure diagnostics collection by checking out the repo and invoking the local `e2e-on-failure` composite action with configurable artifact/retention inputs.
